snippet: Marie Malchodi, who works as a “book conservation technician” at Brown University, recently came across a piece of paper signed by “P. Revere Sculp” — and knew it might be a big find.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column recounts Marie Malchodi's discovery of a rare engraving by Paul Revere at Brown University's John Hay Library; notes that Malchodi, a book conservation technician, found the print folded up and tucked into an 18th-century medical text.
lead_paragraph: Marie Malchodi, who works as a “book conservation technician” at Brown University, recently came across a piece of paper signed by “P. Revere Sculp” — and knew it might be a big find.

headline.print_headline: A Rarity, Even for the Rare Book Room
headline.seo: Paul Revere’s Work Found in Brown’s Rare Book Room
headline.main: Stumbling Across a Rarity, Even for the Rare Book Room
